title: Anthropromorphic Soft Robotics Hand
description: University Biomechtronics Project that explored the design and development of a print in place robotics fingers.
what: Built and integrated an underwater camera system to monitor and track the position of the insaive seaweed species Caulerpa.
how: The camera system was built using a Raspberry Pi and a camera module. The camera was mounted on a custom 3D printed mount that was attached to the ROV. The camera was then connected to the Raspberry Pi and the video feed was streamed to a laptop on the surface.
result: The camera system was able to successfully track the position of the Caulerpa and provide real-time data to the research team. This data was then used to develop a plan to remove the invasive species from the Gulf.
